trans-unit.source: Get started with Azure Notification Hubs | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Get started with Azure Notification Hubs | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you learn how to use Azure Notification Hubs to push notifications to Android devices.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you learn how to use Azure Notification Hubs to push notifications to Android devices.

trans-unit.source: Get started with Notification Hubs
trans-unit.target: Get started with Notification Hubs

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to use Azure Notification Hubs to send push notifications to an Android application.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to use Azure Notification Hubs to send push notifications to an Android application.

trans-unit.source: You'll create a blank Android app that receives push notifications by using Google Cloud Messaging (GCM).
trans-unit.target: You'll create a blank Android app that receives push notifications by using Google Cloud Messaging (GCM).

trans-unit.source: When you're finished, you'll be able to use your notification hub to broadcast push notifications to all the devices running your app.
trans-unit.target: When you're finished, you'll be able to use your notification hub to broadcast push notifications to all the devices running your app.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial demonstrates the simple broadcast scenario in using Notification Hubs.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial demonstrates the simple broadcast scenario in using Notification Hubs.

trans-unit.source: Be sure to follow along with the next tutorial to see how to use Notification Hubs to address specific users and groups of devices.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to follow along with the next tutorial to see how to use Notification Hubs to address specific users and groups of devices.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: This tutorial requires the following:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial requires the following:

trans-unit.source: Android Studio, which you can download from the Android site.
trans-unit.target: Android Studio, which you can download from the Android site.

trans-unit.source: An active Azure account.
trans-unit.target: An active Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Azure Free Trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/?WT.mc_id=A0E0E5C02&returnurl=http%3A%2F%2Fazure.microsoft.com%2Fen-us%2Fdocumentation%2Farticles%2Fnotification-hubs-android-get-started%2F).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Azure Free Trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/?WT.mc_id=A0E0E5C02&returnurl=http%3A%2F%2Fazure.microsoft.com%2Fen-us%2Fdocumentation%2Farticles%2Fnotification-hubs-android-get-started%2F).

trans-unit.source: Completing this tutorial is a prerequisite for all other Notification Hubs tutorials for Android apps.
trans-unit.target: Completing this tutorial is a prerequisite for all other Notification Hubs tutorials for Android apps.

trans-unit.source: Create a project that supports Google Cloud Messaging
trans-unit.target: Create a project that supports Google Cloud Messaging

trans-unit.source: Configure a new notification hub
trans-unit.target: Configure a new notification hub

trans-unit.source: Connect your app to the notification hub
trans-unit.target: Connect your app to the notification hub

trans-unit.source: Create a new Android project
trans-unit.target: Create a new Android project

trans-unit.source: In Android Studio, start a new Android Studio project.
trans-unit.target: In Android Studio, start a new Android Studio project.

trans-unit.source: Choose the **Phone and Tablet** form factor and the **Minimum SDK** that you want to support.
trans-unit.target: Choose the **Phone and Tablet** form factor and the **Minimum SDK** that you want to support.

trans-unit.source: Then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Choose **Blank Activity** for the main activity, click **Next**, and then click **Finish**.
trans-unit.target: Choose **Blank Activity** for the main activity, click **Next**, and then click **Finish**.

trans-unit.source: Add Google Play services to the project
trans-unit.target: Add Google Play services to the project

trans-unit.source: Add code
trans-unit.target: Add code

trans-unit.source: Download the Notification Hubs Android SDK.
trans-unit.target: Download the Notification Hubs Android SDK.

trans-unit.source: Extract the .zip file and copy **notificationhubs\notification-hubs-0.4.jar** and **notifications\notifications-1.0.1.jar** to the **app\libs** directory of your project.
trans-unit.target: Extract the .zip file and copy **notificationhubs\notification-hubs-0.4.jar** and **notifications\notifications-1.0.1.jar** to the **app\libs** directory of your project.

trans-unit.source: You can do this by dragging the files directly into the **libs** folder in the Project View window of Android Studio.
trans-unit.target: You can do this by dragging the files directly into the **libs** folder in the Project View window of Android Studio.

trans-unit.source: Refresh the **libs** folder.
trans-unit.target: Refresh the **libs** folder.

trans-unit.source: Set up the application to obtain a registration ID from GCM, and use it to register the app instance to the notification hub.
trans-unit.target: Set up the application to obtain a registration ID from GCM, and use it to register the app instance to the notification hub.

trans-unit.source: In the AndroidManifest.xml file, add the following permissions below the `</application>` tag.
trans-unit.target: In the AndroidManifest.xml file, add the following permissions below the `</application>` tag.

trans-unit.source: Make sure to replace `<your package>` with the package name shown at the top of the AndroidManifest.xml file (`com.example.testnotificationhubs` in this example).
trans-unit.target: Make sure to replace `<your package>` with the package name shown at the top of the AndroidManifest.xml file (`com.example.testnotificationhubs` in this example).

trans-unit.source: In the **MainActivity** class, add the following `import` statements above the class declaration.
trans-unit.target: In the **MainActivity** class, add the following `import` statements above the class declaration.

trans-unit.source: Add the following private members at the top of the class.
trans-unit.target: Add the following private members at the top of the class.

trans-unit.source: Make sure to update the three placeholders:
trans-unit.target: Make sure to update the three placeholders:

trans-unit.source: **SENDER_ID**: Set `SENDER_ID` to the project number that you obtained earlier from the project that you created in the [Google Cloud Console](http://cloud.google.com/console).
trans-unit.target: **SENDER_ID**: Set `SENDER_ID` to the project number that you obtained earlier from the project that you created in the [Google Cloud Console](http://cloud.google.com/console).

trans-unit.source: **HubListenConnectionString**: Set `HubListenConnectionString` to the **DefaultListenAccessSignature** connection string for your hub.
trans-unit.target: **HubListenConnectionString**: Set `HubListenConnectionString` to the **DefaultListenAccessSignature** connection string for your hub.

trans-unit.source: You can copy that connection string by clicking **View Connection String** on the **Dashboard** tab of your hub on the [Azure portal].
trans-unit.target: You can copy that connection string by clicking **View Connection String** on the **Dashboard** tab of your hub on the [Azure portal].

trans-unit.source: **HubName**: Use the name of your notification hub that appears at the top of the page in Azure for your hub (**not** the full URL).
trans-unit.target: **HubName**: Use the name of your notification hub that appears at the top of the page in Azure for your hub (**not** the full URL).

trans-unit.source: For example, use `"myhub"`.
trans-unit.target: For example, use `"myhub"`.

trans-unit.source: In the **OnCreate** method of the **MainActivity** class, add the following code to perform the registration on creation of the activity.
trans-unit.target: In the **OnCreate** method of the **MainActivity** class, add the following code to perform the registration on creation of the activity.

trans-unit.source: In **MainActivity.java**, add the code below for the **registerWithNotificationHubs()** method.
trans-unit.target: In **MainActivity.java**, add the code below for the **registerWithNotificationHubs()** method.

trans-unit.source: This method reports success after registering with Google Cloud Messaging and the notification hub.
trans-unit.target: This method reports success after registering with Google Cloud Messaging and the notification hub.

trans-unit.source: Add the **DialogNotify** method to the activity to display the notification when the app is running and visible.
trans-unit.target: Add the **DialogNotify** method to the activity to display the notification when the app is running and visible.

trans-unit.source: Also override **onStart** and **onStop** to determine whether the activity is visible to display the dialog.
trans-unit.target: Also override **onStart** and **onStop** to determine whether the activity is visible to display the dialog.

trans-unit.source: Because Android does not display notifications, you must write your own receiver.
trans-unit.target: Because Android does not display notifications, you must write your own receiver.

trans-unit.source: In **AndroidManifest.xml**, add the following element inside the `<application>` element.
trans-unit.target: In **AndroidManifest.xml**, add the following element inside the `<application>` element.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Replace the placeholder with your package name.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Replace the placeholder with your package name.

trans-unit.source: In the Project View, expand **app** > **src** > **main** > **java**.
trans-unit.target: In the Project View, expand **app** > **src** > **main** > **java**.

trans-unit.source: Right-click your package folder under **java**, click **New**, and then click **Java Class**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click your package folder under **java**, click **New**, and then click **Java Class**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Name** field for the new class, type **MyHandler**, and then click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Name** field for the new class, type **MyHandler**, and then click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: Add the following import statements at the top of **MyHandler.java**:
trans-unit.target: Add the following import statements at the top of **MyHandler.java**:

trans-unit.source: Update the class declaration as follows to make `MyHandler` a subclass of `com.microsoft.windowsazure.notifications.NotificationsHandler` as shown below.
trans-unit.target: Update the class declaration as follows to make `MyHandler` a subclass of `com.microsoft.windowsazure.notifications.NotificationsHandler` as shown below.

trans-unit.source: Add the following code for the `MyHandler` class.
trans-unit.target: Add the following code for the `MyHandler` class.

trans-unit.source: This code overrides the `OnReceive` method, so the handler will pop up an `AlertDialog` to show notifications that are received.
trans-unit.target: This code overrides the `OnReceive` method, so the handler will pop up an `AlertDialog` to show notifications that are received.

trans-unit.source: The handler also sends the notification to the Android notification manager by using the `sendNotification()` method.
trans-unit.target: The handler also sends the notification to the Android notification manager by using the `sendNotification()` method.

trans-unit.source: In Android Studio on the menu bar, click **Build** > **Rebuild Project** to make sure that no errors are detected.
trans-unit.target: In Android Studio on the menu bar, click **Build** > **Rebuild Project** to make sure that no errors are detected.

trans-unit.source: Send notifications
trans-unit.target: Send notifications

trans-unit.source: You can test receiving notifications in your app by sending notifications in the Azure portal via the debug tab on the notification hub, as shown in the screen below.
trans-unit.target: You can test receiving notifications in your app by sending notifications in the Azure portal via the debug tab on the notification hub, as shown in the screen below.

trans-unit.source: In Android Studio Project View, expand **App** > **src** > **main** > **res** > **layout**.
trans-unit.target: In Android Studio Project View, expand **App** > **src** > **main** > **res** > **layout**.

trans-unit.source: Open the **activity_main.xml** layout file and click the **Text** tab to update the text contents of the file.
trans-unit.target: Open the **activity_main.xml** layout file and click the **Text** tab to update the text contents of the file.

trans-unit.source: Update it with the code below, which adds new `Button` and `EditText` controls for sending notification messages to the notification hub.
trans-unit.target: Update it with the code below, which adds new `Button` and `EditText` controls for sending notification messages to the notification hub.

trans-unit.source: Add this code at the bottom, just before `</RelativeLayout>`.
trans-unit.target: Add this code at the bottom, just before `</RelativeLayout>`.

trans-unit.source: In Android Studio Project View, expand **App** > **src** > **main** > **res** > **values**.
trans-unit.target: In Android Studio Project View, expand **App** > **src** > **main** > **res** > **values**.

trans-unit.source: Open the **strings.xml** file and add the string values that are referenced by the new `Button` and `EditText` controls.
trans-unit.target: Open the **strings.xml** file and add the string values that are referenced by the new `Button` and `EditText` controls.

trans-unit.source: Add these at the bottom of the file, just before `</resources>`.
trans-unit.target: Add these at the bottom of the file, just before `</resources>`.

trans-unit.source: In your **MainActivity.java** file, add the following `import` statements above the `MainActivity` class.
trans-unit.target: In your **MainActivity.java** file, add the following `import` statements above the `MainActivity` class.

trans-unit.source: In your **MainActivity.java** file, add the following members at the top of the `MainActivity` class.
trans-unit.target: In your **MainActivity.java** file, add the following members at the top of the `MainActivity` class.

trans-unit.source: Enter the name of your hub for `HubName`, not the namespace.
trans-unit.target: Enter the name of your hub for `HubName`, not the namespace.

trans-unit.source: For example, enter "myhub".
trans-unit.target: For example, enter "myhub".

trans-unit.source: Also, enter the **DefaultFullSharedAccessSignature** connection string.
trans-unit.target: Also, enter the **DefaultFullSharedAccessSignature** connection string.

trans-unit.source: This connection string can be copied from the [Azure portal] by clicking **View Connection String** on the **Dashboard** tab for your notification hub.
trans-unit.target: This connection string can be copied from the [Azure portal] by clicking **View Connection String** on the **Dashboard** tab for your notification hub.

trans-unit.source: Your activity holds the hub name and the full shared access connection string for the hub.
trans-unit.target: Your activity holds the hub name and the full shared access connection string for the hub.

trans-unit.source: You must create a Software Access Signature (SaS) token to authenticate a POST request to send messages to your notification hub.
trans-unit.target: You must create a Software Access Signature (SaS) token to authenticate a POST request to send messages to your notification hub.

trans-unit.source: This is done by parsing the key data from the connection string and then creating the SaS token, as mentioned in the [Common Concepts](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn495627.aspx) REST API reference.
trans-unit.target: This is done by parsing the key data from the connection string and then creating the SaS token, as mentioned in the [Common Concepts](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn495627.aspx) REST API reference.

trans-unit.source: In **MainActivity.java**, add the following method to the `MainActivity` class to parse your connection string.
trans-unit.target: In **MainActivity.java**, add the following method to the `MainActivity` class to parse your connection string.

trans-unit.source: In **MainActivity.java**, add the following method to the `MainActivity` class to create a SaS authentication token.
trans-unit.target: In **MainActivity.java**, add the following method to the `MainActivity` class to create a SaS authentication token.

trans-unit.source: In **MainActivity.java**, add the following method to the `MainActivity` class to handle the **Send Notification** button click and send the notification message to the hub by using the REST API.
trans-unit.target: In **MainActivity.java**, add the following method to the `MainActivity` class to handle the **Send Notification** button click and send the notification message to the hub by using the REST API.

trans-unit.source: Test your app
trans-unit.target: Test your app

trans-unit.source: Emulator testing
trans-unit.target: Emulator testing

trans-unit.source: If you want to test on an emulator, make sure that your emulator image supports the Google API level that you choose for your app.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test on an emulator, make sure that your emulator image supports the Google API level that you choose for your app.

trans-unit.source: If your image doesn't support the Google APIs, you will end up with the **SERVICE\_NOT\_AVAILABLE** exception.
trans-unit.target: If your image doesn't support the Google APIs, you will end up with the **SERVICE\_NOT\_AVAILABLE** exception.

trans-unit.source: Also make sure that you have added your Google account to your running emulator under **Settings** > **Accounts**.
trans-unit.target: Also make sure that you have added your Google account to your running emulator under **Settings** > **Accounts**.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, your attempts to register with GCM may result in the **AUTHENTICATION\_FAILED** exception.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, your attempts to register with GCM may result in the **AUTHENTICATION\_FAILED** exception.

trans-unit.source: Testing the app
trans-unit.target: Testing the app

trans-unit.source: Run the app and notice that the registration ID is reported for a successful registration.
trans-unit.target: Run the app and notice that the registration ID is reported for a successful registration.

trans-unit.source: Enter a notification message to be sent to all Android devices that have registered with the hub.
trans-unit.target: Enter a notification message to be sent to all Android devices that have registered with the hub.

trans-unit.source: Press **Send Notification**.
trans-unit.target: Press **Send Notification**.

trans-unit.source: Any devices that have the app running will show an `AlertDialog` with the notification message.
trans-unit.target: Any devices that have the app running will show an `AlertDialog` with the notification message.

trans-unit.source: Devices that don't have the app running but were previously registered for the notifications will receive a notification added to the notification manager.
trans-unit.target: Devices that don't have the app running but were previously registered for the notifications will receive a notification added to the notification manager.

trans-unit.source: Notifications can be viewed by swiping down from the upper-left corner.
trans-unit.target: Notifications can be viewed by swiping down from the upper-left corner.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: In this simple example, you broadcast notifications to all your Android devices.
trans-unit.target: In this simple example, you broadcast notifications to all your Android devices.

trans-unit.source: In order to target specific users, refer to the tutorial [Use Notification Hubs to push notifications to users].
trans-unit.target: In order to target specific users, refer to the tutorial [Use Notification Hubs to push notifications to users].

trans-unit.source: If you want to segment your users by interest groups, you can read [Use Notification Hubs to send breaking news].
trans-unit.target: If you want to segment your users by interest groups, you can read [Use Notification Hubs to send breaking news].

trans-unit.source: Learn more about how to use Notification Hubs in [Notification Hubs Guidance].
trans-unit.target: Learn more about how to use Notification Hubs in [Notification Hubs Guidance].
